alert.note: Alert for Kern (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 06 at 10:23PM PDT until further notice by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM PDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following county, Kern. * WHEN...Until 1215 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1023 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bakersfield, Rosedale, Lamont and Weedpatch. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
